revised_title: Urinary Organs and Urine Composition in Two Rana Species
tldr: The author conducted a study on the urinary organs and urine composition of two species of the genus Rana, the bull-frog and the brown-toad. They discovered that the urine of these species contains urea and has different physical and chemical properties compared to other amphibians. The study also highlights the importance of the structure of the kidneys in the secretion process and the relationship between diet and urine composition.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Comparative Anatomy
